shortdesc.ph: Callback triggered when the remote media stream switches between audio and video due to network changes.
callback. Triggered when the remote media stream switches between audio and video due to network changes.

p.codeblock: public void onRemoteSubscribeFallbackToAudioOnly(int uid, boolean isFallbackOrRecover)

section.p:
If you call and set option to STREAM_FALLBACK_OPTION_AUDIO_ONLY, the SDK triggers this callback in the following cases:
The subscribed video stream is downgraded to audio-only due to poor downlink network conditions.
The subscribed stream recovers to video when the network improves.

If you call setRemoteSubscribeFallbackOption and set option to STREAM_FALLBACK_OPTION_AUDIO_ONLY, the SDK triggers this callback in the following cases:
The subscribed video stream switches to audio-only due to poor downlink network conditions.
The subscribed stream switches back to video after the network improves.
section.note: When the remote media stream switches to a low-quality video stream due to weak network, you can monitor the switch between high-quality and low-quality video streams via the callback.
You can monitor the switch between high-quality and low-quality video streams in the callback.

section.title: Trigger Timing
section.p: This callback is triggered when the remote media stream switches between audio and video due to network changes.
